title: On statistical arbitrage under a conditional factor model of equity returns. (arXiv:2309.02205v1 [q-fin.ST])
abstract: We consider a conditional factor model for a multivariate portfolio of United States equities in the context of analysing a statistical arbitrage trading strategy. A state space framework underlies the factor model whereby asset returns are assumed to be a noisy observation of a linear combination of factor values and latent factor risk premia. Filter and state prediction estimates for the risk premia are retrieved in an online way. Such estimates induce filtered asset returns that can be compared to measurement observations, with large deviations representing candidate mean reversion trades. Further, in that the risk premia are modelled as time-varying quantities, non-stationarity in returns is de facto captured. We study an empirical trading strategy respectful of transaction costs, and demonstrate performance over a long history of 29 years, for both a linear and a non-linear state space model. Our results show that the model is competitive relative to the results of other methods,

translated_title: 关于在条件因子模型下的统计套利（股权回报）问题
translated_abstract: 我们考虑在统计套利交易策略分析的背景下，使用一个条件因子模型来分析美国股票的多元投资组合。该模型使用状态空间框架，其中假设资产回报是因子值和潜在因子风险溢价的线性组合的噪声观测。通过在线方式获得风险溢价的滤波和状态预测估计。这些估计产生了经过滤波的资产回报，可以与观测结果进行比较，较大的偏差表示可能的均值回归交易。此外，由于风险溢价被建模为时变量，因此捕捉到了收益的非稳态性。我们研究了一种考虑交易成本的经验交易策略，并展示了在29年的长期历史上线性和非线性状态空间模型的表现。我们的结果表明，该模型相对于其他方法具有竞争优势。
tldr: 本研究通过使用条件因子模型分析美国股票的投资组合，提出了一种统计套利交易策略，并在考虑交易成本的情况下进行了实证研究。该模型相对于其他方法具有竞争优势。
en_tdlr: This study proposes a statistical arbitrage trading strategy by analyzing a multivariate portfolio of US equities using a conditional factor Model. The model captures non-stationarity in returns by modeling time-varying risk premia. The empirical results show that the model is competitive compared to other methods.
